::Fenox::

Fenox nods, seeing that Vlad was obviously troubled.

"Sure, you can stay here. I'll get you some quarters if you wish."



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Carnage Blood" <Carnage@d...> wrote:
> ** Vlad looked up in surprise as he heard Fenox ask if he was 
alright, his optics looking her over quickly in his secondary shock 
before darting towards the blank view-screen of the information 
console.  No one had ever cared how he felt before, well, other then 
his own mother and she was deceased now. Had been for almost a full 
year, but that was expected.   
> But he just could NOT figure it out. He had come here explicitly to 
kill Von and take the right to their mother's property, now however, 
realizing the Von had died long before he had ever expected, Vlad 
wasn't so sure that it was what he wanted anymore. Knowing now that 
he was the last of his entire family was lonely, to put not to fine a 
point on it.  But why did he feel this? He should have been overjoyed 
that he was the soul keeper of the property now, didn't have to wait 
in line while Von took it instead.  But the only way that Vlad could 
decide that he felt this way was that he would have felt that he had 
earned the right to those lands if he could have killed Von, proving 
that he was the smarter of the two. But not only that, but he had 
looked forward to see his older half brother, even though he was 
planning to kill him in the end. But even then he hadn't planned to 
kill him himself he was going to hire somebot to do it for him and 
even then he was going to make sure that it was quick and painless. 
Vlad would have had no other choice but to have killed Von anyway, it 
was the only way. The way of a Predacon.
> If a Predacon wanted something he killed to get it, instead of just 
taking when the person had the chance to take revenge and then only 
cause the Predacon troubles that could have been prevented.
> So Vlad cleared his throat and took in a deep breath, blocking out 
the thoughts that he was alone as far as family went. But not as far 
as people, company.
> But Vlad never let any of this drip from his solid expression, 
finally deciding that this was simply a set back and finding a way to 
get home to claim his rights before they were void. So, to replace 
what empty feeling might dwell in a spark which he meant to be solid 
and unyielding, he looked back at Fenox and smiled.**  " Yeah, I'm 
ok. Just had to check something."
> ** He lifted a brow.** " Hay. Would you mind if I stayed here for a 
bit. I'm afraid I don't know this world very well."
> 
>
